title: Government school website with public pages and password-protected admin panel

requirements.text: Create the public-facing government school website with a complete navigation and pages/sections: Home, About the School, Admissions, Academics, Staff/Faculty, News & Notices, Gallery, and Contact.

quotes: Create a government school website with all future and with admin panel url on password ðŸ”‘

acceptanceCriteria: Top-level navigation links to all required pages/sections
Each page renders meaningful placeholder content in English that can later be managed via the admin panel
Site layout is responsive for mobile/tablet/desktop

requirements.text: Implement a consistent visual theme for the site (colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) suitable for an official government school identity, and apply it across all pages.
acceptanceCriteria: Theme is applied consistently across public pages and admin pages
Avoid blue/purple as primary colors (use a different coherent palette)
Typography and spacing feel formal/official and readable

requirements.text: Implement backend content models and canister APIs to store and retrieve all website content needed for the public pages (school profile text, admissions info, academics info, staff list, notices/news posts, gallery items, contact details).

quotes: government school website with all future

acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes query methods for public content reads
Backend exposes update methods for admin-only content writes
Data persists across canister upgrades using stable storage (no migration file required for initial build)

requirements.text: Build a password-protected admin panel that allows authorized admins to manage site content (create/edit/delete staff entries, notices/news posts, gallery items, and edit page content blocks and contact details).

quotes: with admin panel url on password ðŸ”‘

acceptanceCriteria: Admin UI includes login form requiring a password
After login, admin can perform CRUD actions for required content types and changes appear on public pages
All admin write operations are rejected by the backend unless authenticated

requirements.text: Protect access to the admin panel and its URL by requiring a password before showing admin content; unauthenticated users must not be able to view admin dashboard screens or perform admin operations.
acceptanceCriteria: Visiting the admin route while unauthenticated shows only a password prompt (no admin data rendered)
Admin API calls require an authenticated session/token and fail without it
Provide a logout action that clears the local session and returns to the password prompt

requirements.text: Add an admin settings capability to change the admin password (requiring the current password), with the password stored securely in the backend (hashed, not plaintext).
acceptanceCriteria: Backend stores only a password hash (no plaintext password)
Admin can update the password only after providing the current password
After password change, old password no longer grants access

requirements.text: Add a Contact page form that lets visitors submit inquiries to the school; store submissions in the backend and allow admins to view and delete them in the admin panel.
acceptanceCriteria: Public contact form validates required fields and submits to the backend
Admin panel lists submitted inquiries with timestamp and message details
Admin can delete inquiries and they no longer appear in the list

requirements.text: Add gallery support where public users can view a gallery grid and admins can add/remove gallery entries, including support for linking to image assets stored as frontend static files.
acceptanceCriteria: Public Gallery page shows a grid/list of gallery items
Admin can add/edit/remove gallery entries (title/description and image reference)
Gallery entries persist and render correctly after refresh

requirements.text: Add a News & Notices system where admins can publish notices (title, body, date) and the public site shows a list view and detail view.
acceptanceCriteria: Public notices list is sorted with newest first
Each notice has a dedicated detail view
Admin can create/edit/delete notices and changes reflect on the public site

requirements.text: Generate and include required static images in the frontend (placed in frontend/public/assets/generated) and use them in the site (header/footer/hero as appropriate) without routing image delivery through the backend.
acceptanceCriteria: All required generated images exist under frontend/public/assets/generated with the exact filenames specified
Public pages render using the generated images via static paths
No backend endpoints are used to serve these images

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor (all backend logic in backend/main.mo).
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui or other immutable paths listed by the system.
Use Internet Computer canister storage only (no external databases or third-party auth providers).
nonGoals: Real-time chat, push notifications, or email/SMS sending integrations.
Uploading user images directly to the backend (gallery uses static frontend assets or URLs).

required: Government school emblem/crest style logo, flat vector look (school-logo.dim_512x512.png)
Wide hero banner illustration of a government school campus building with students, clean minimal style (hero-campus.dim_1600x600.png)
Set of simple outline icons for: admissions, academics, staff, notices, gallery, contact (school-icons.dim_512x512.png)
